reviews.text: Wonderful park with a great scenic layout.

I've been coming here since I was young and it's always been a lovely place to wander and learn. Some really interesting exhibitions that change from time to time, including a section with a mummified person, a bonnie Prince Charles interactive room, a section on Anglo saxon, viking and very early fossils and excavations, animals, soldiers and of course paintings from Joseph Wright. Well worth a visit.

Central location at the end of the Strand in Derby city centre within easy walking distance from bus stops at the Morledge or Corporation street. Stairs or lifts to various floors, free entrance, even to Leonardo exhibition which we saw, then onto Joseph Wrights famous artworks, with his wonderful play on light. There's natural history section, all free, make a donation at your discretion a real gem in Derby.

I remember visiting the museum before and I was amazed. Now I went for the Leonardo exhibition and I was disappointed in the few drawings there were. Only one room dedicated to the renaissance genius. But it's better than nothing. The book I bought seems very good. I hope future exhibitions are better.

Just popped in to look at what was happening on the Pangolin event being run by the museum Good for the children and families. Well run with interesting things to do and see. Children seemed to enjoy it looking for hidden models of Pangolins

Visited to see the De Vinci drawings. Really well displayed, they even lend magnifying glasses, plus have translations of the texts. Helpers very knowledgeable and friendly. Great that something so famous should come to Derby.

I've been coming here since I was young and it's always been a lovely place to wander and learn. Some really interesting exhibitions that change from time to time, including a section with a mummified person, a bonnie Prince Charles interactive room, a section on Anglo saxon, viking and very early fossils and excavations, animals, soldiers and of course paintings from Joseph Wright. Well worth a visit.

Central location at the end of the Strand in Derby city centre within easy walking distance from bus stops at the Morledge or Corporation street. Stairs or lifts to various floors, free entrance, even to Leonardo exhibition which we saw, then onto Joseph Wrights famous artworks, with his wonderful play on light. There's natural history section, all free, make a donation at your discretion a real gem in Derby.

I remember visiting the museum before and I was amazed. Now I went for the Leonardo exhibition and I was disappointed in the few drawings there were. Only one room dedicated to the renaissance genius. But it's better than nothing. The book I bought seems very good. I hope future exhibitions are better.

Just popped in to look at what was happening on the Pangolin event being run by the museum Good for the children and families. Well run with interesting things to do and see. Children seemed to enjoy it looking for hidden models of Pangolins

Visited to see the De Vinci drawings. Really well displayed, they even lend magnifying glasses, plus have translations of the texts. Helpers very knowledgeable and friendly. Great that something so famous should come to Derby.

I was at Pickford House in Derby recently it is located on Friar Gate very close to the famous Friagate old railway station bridge. The museum is a quaint old Victorian era building and is like a tardis inside. There is currently a fashion house exhibition which is a fascinating view back to the old century's clothing for the rich and famous. As usual these items were skillfully made by the "workers" who of course didn't have so good. The kitchens are good, there's an old WW2 bomb shelter. Make a high light of your visit and use the Victorian Facilities, as the old fashioned toilets are available for public use. All admission is free but donations are voluntary.

Very nice experience visiting this museum, which was called " Beyond the Velvet Rope tour", to see what a Georgian house built in the 1700 really looked like. The whole tour was a real delight with a tour guide dressed in costume of the era and very knowledgeable about the house. The premises is also used for a  display of Agatha Christie memorabilia and mystery clues. The tour guide is a must, as you will not learn as much without. There is no entrance fee but they do like a donation. Well worth a visit

Well worth a visit. Really beautiful house with very interesting displays. Can visit all floors of the hose including the cellers. Even public loos are period! Staff very friendly and helpful. Loved it!

Little quaint old house, lovely display and great to visit considering it's free! A nice place to relax and it's on the main road into the city centre too. Really enjoyed their themed Christmas and Agatha Christie displays! And their little dressing up stuff!
Fantastic museum with very knowledgeable, friendly staff. We had a guided tour by a very knowledgeable gentleman. Refreshments are available but limited to, tea, coffee, squash and biscuits
It is stunning. Although rarely ever open, what's beyond those doors is something so beautiful that it's unreal that it was built by hunans.
Just a nice chapel

Chilled pub, great to watch a sports game or just have a relaxed bite to eat while chatting. They have a nice bar area and smoking area. And you are bound to have a good time there. The staff there are really fun and have such wonderful personalities.

Good day Royal Oak what a plate of good food as always even with  load shedding 
Love and Blessings 
SANDRA Seebregts (Mr Loubser)
A long-standing and pretty convincing approximation of a traditional English pub. Food wasn't bad. Local crowd, many of them ex-pats. Friendly owners.
Cheapish and cheerful for a quick pub lunch. Good food
Very good food. Cosy pub
First time ordering from Basmati Indian tonight, upon collection I was informed of the restaurant was under new management. The order was lovely I would highly recommend.

Superb Indian food served here by a family run business. The owners are always friendly and helpful and will make suggestions for new dishes to try. I have been coming here for years, through changes of ownership, and it has remained great in terms of quality, price and more importantly the food is always delicious and authentic-tasting, whether eating in or taking away. Their take away service and food is always excellent. Highly recommended.
Fantastic food and great staff thank you for making our wedding anniversary so lovely xx

Fabulous food as always; with amazing service to match! Always have an amazing meal here; would highly recommend. They also have an impressive range of vegan food and sides etc. definitely worth checking out!

Having just moved to the area we wanted to find our local 'go to restaurant... We needn't look any further this place is lovely. The good is fantastic and the people who work there are so friendly and welcoming.

Delicious food and excellent service! Tonight was our first experience eating Indian cuisine. Our waiter was knowledgeable and friendly with his recommendations and my husband and I both truly enjoyed our experiences.  We would recommend this restaurant to friends and family, and we will definitely be coming back ourselves.
This place was great. We ordered Lamb chops and chicken masala? (The first menu in curry categories) and they were nice. We will visit there again definitely.
The food is amazing and the wait staff so friendly. Every time we are in Ann Arbor we eat there as no other Indian restaurant is as good. We've been eating there for 20 years.

One of the best Indian restaurants I've eaten at and I have been eating there for years. Reminds me of the nicer Indian restaurants in Great Brittan where I first tried Indian food. Authentic food served in a very nice atmosphere. The waiters are all very professional and efficient. I asked about a dish I used to order but was not on the menu now and the waiter said they would make it for me... Chicken Hyderabadi (not sure I spelled that right) delicious! I'll back when I'm in town again.

The food is delicious in every word possible! I went with my mom, and she's usually picky when it comes to food, but she absolutely loved their food. Our waiter was the best! The prices are not that bad. The service was good, a man in a suit (I believe the owner) came to our to check up on us. All in all, it was a great first experience.

A fairly wide range of dishes. Great food. Clean. Staff courteous. The chicken with pepper and black bean sauce was very good. Maybe a wider range of dessert would've helped, but overall a great place to enjoy a meal  with family/friends (as it can get quite loud). Superb value for money. Would recommend !

Good value Chinese buffet with a good range of dishes in the evening. Pleasant and attentive staff. Can get a bit noisy sometimes but only because it is popular and busy. Does what it's designed for if you are hungry for good quality Chinese.

Really nice food. Decent staff, very attentive and good atmosphere.
Slightly cramped in some areas but pretty much something for everyone.

The food was decent but nothing special but it's an all-you-can-eat so you don't expect 5 star cuisine. Me and the Mrs both got up to get some food and when we came back they'd given our seat away. It was hilarious but definitely not good customer service.

Buffet food is poor quality. Staff are rude. 
They only care about your money. 
Do not go there.

I LOVE this place! The food is to die for and the atmosphere is so warm and friendly.

Always a fantastic meal every time we go. Highly recommended. I'd say one if the best restaurants in Derby.
Yes! Amazing restaurant! Waiters are super friendly and the food is really delicious. Took my son down and we both really enjoyed nice and authentic decor and food 5 stars fully deserved 👍

Booked a table for my partner's birthday and had the most excellent dining experience. The food was excellent and the service matches and food quality. Excellent attention to detail and caring attentive service.

Would absolutely recommend especially to those experiencing the loss of MexiCo from the Intu centre. (I was), this is way better!

Parking is easy behind the building (free after 8pm) and you will leave full and satisfied!

Ordered from them for the first time, and my goodness you couldn't be more AMAZING! Genuinely the best burrito I have ever had in my LIFE! Incredible, so flavourful, an amazing price and comes with fries?
Pepitos is amazing, please go here and get a burrito! You will not be disappointed.
11/10.
Really nice atmosphere, delicious food. Highly recommended!
